abstract_summ: Material: The data regarding urological procedures realized in the 8 academic urological departments of Parisians centres (AP-HP) were compared over two similar periods (14-29 March 2019 and 12-27 March 2020) using the centralized surgical planning software shared by these centres.At the same time, one should aim to ensure adequate care for urological emergencies and urgent urological treatments as far as possible, even during the pandemic.SUMMARY: Although the COVID-19 pandemic will inevitably affect urological services, steps can be taken to mitigate the impact and prioritize the patients most in need of urgent care.Conclusion: Lockdown and postponement of non-urgent scheduled urological procedures decisions has led to a drastic decrease in surgical activity in AP-HP.Outpatient departments are of great importance in the care, examination and coordination of urological emergencies and urgent treatment.
title_summ: Urological implications of SARS CoV-19.Gynecologic oncology at the time of COVID-19 outbreakManagement of Gynecology Patients during COVID-19 Pandemic: Chinese Expert ConsensusUrologie in der Corona-Virus-PandemieManagement of orthopedic oncology patients during coronavirus pandemic.– Leitfaden 4/20Where do urologists stand in the era of novel coronavirus-2019 diseaseImpact de la pandémie de COVID-19 sur l’activité chirurgicale au sein des services d’urologie de l’Assistance Publique -Hôpitaux de Paris
title_abstract_phrases: At the same time, one should aim to ensure adequate care for urological emergencies and urgent urological treatments as far as possible, even during the pandemic.SUMMARY: Although the COVID-19 pandemic will inevitably affect urological services, steps can be taken to mitigate the impact and prioritize the patients most in need of urgent care.Management of Gynecology Patients during COVID-19 Pandemic: Chinese Expert ConsensusAbstract: Since December 2019, the outbreak of novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) became a major epidemic threat in China and later spread worldwide.Conclusion: Lockdown and postponement of non-urgent scheduled urological procedures decisions has led to a drastic decrease in surgical activity in AP-HP.Management of orthopedic oncology patients during coronavirus pandemic.
